meanings.definition: To sing better or louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, Sarah was outsinging all the other contestants.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys outsinging her friends at karaoke nights.
meanings.sent3: The birds in the park were outsinging each other in a friendly contest.
meanings.sent4: His powerful voice outsang the entire choir during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The little girl outsinging her siblings became the highlight of the family gathering.

meanings.definition: The act of singing better or louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outsinging of the national anthem was truly impressive.
meanings.sent2: The outsinging of the soloist captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's outsinging of the dog made everyone in the house laugh.
meanings.sent4: The outsinging of the opera singer echoed through the grand hall.
meanings.sent5: The outsinging of the choir filled the church with beautiful melodies.
